intro: Picrasma andamanica, commonly known as Andaman yellowwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Hypericaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red berries that are toxic to humans. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
